Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

  • java.lang.Object
    • ePortfolio.Portfolio
  • public class Portfolio
extends java.lang.Object
    Portfolio class holds all of the methods for manipulating data as well the main for the program

                         throws java.lang.Exception
        creates a new investment and adds it to the investment portfolio
        Parameters:
        input - array of strings with new investment data
        invests - ArrayList holding all the previously bought investments
        wordIndex - Hashmap that keeps track of which words are associated with which investments
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addHashItem

        private void addHashItem​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> wordIndex,
                         int index,
                         java.lang.String keywords)
        addHashItem adds or updates all the keyswords in a new invesments title
        Parameters:
        wordIndex - Hashmap that keeps track of which words are associated with which investments
        index - index of the investment that was just created
        keywords - name of the invesment

      • removeHashItem

        private void removeHashItem​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> wordIndex,
                            int element,
                            java.lang.String keywords)
        removeHashItem modifies the arrayLists associated with the keywords in the stock name so that hashMap no longer lists the index of those investments being associated with those keywords
        Parameters:
        wordIndex - Hashmap that keeps track of which words are associated with which investments
        element - the index of the investment that is being removed on the investment arrayList
        keywords - name of the invesment

        Parameters:
        input - array of strings with investment info
        invests - Arraylist of investments
        wordIndex - Hashmap that keeps track of which words are associated with which investments

      • updateInvest

        public void updateInvest​(java.util.ArrayList<Investment> invests,
                         double newPrice,
                         int desiredIndex)
        updateInvest prints all of the investments out and prompts the user for a new price for each investment
        Parameters:
        invests - array of investments
        newPrice - user specified new price
        desiredIndex - index in the arrayList of investments that the user would like to edit

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • readFile

        public void readFile​(java.util.ArrayList<Investment> invests,
                     java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> wordIndex,
                     java.io.File inputFile)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        reads the data given by a formatted file
        Parameters:
        invests - ArrayList of investments
        wordIndex - Hashmap that keeps track of which words are associated with which investments
        inputFile - File previously opened by openFile
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the creation of a new investment has invalid values

      • populateFile

        public void populateFile​(java.util.ArrayList<Investment> invests,
                         java.io.File file)
        populates a file with formatted data of every investment the investment array holds before the program finishes
        Parameters:
        invests - arraylist of investments
        file - previously opened file that may or may not have been read from

      • search

        public boolean search​(java.util.ArrayList<Investment> invests,
                      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> wordIndex,
                      java.lang.String symbol,
                      java.lang.String keywordString,
                      java.lang.String low,
                      java.lang.String high,
                      java.util.ArrayList<Investment> matchingInvests)
        search searches through the arraylist of investments for any investments that match the user specified values, uses a hashmap to make searches using keywords much more efficent
        Parameters:
        invests - arraylist of investments
        wordIndex - Hashmap that keeps track of which words are associated with which investments
        symbol - symbol of investment
        keywordString - string of keywords separated by spaces
        low - string specifying the lowest value the price can be
        high - string specifying the highest value the price can be
        matchingInvests - arraylist of investments found to be matches
        Returns:
        false if an error occurs, true if now errors occur
